headline: Deere Expands U.S. Manufacturing To Support Equipment Reliability And Earnings Quality
summary: Deere (NYSE:DE) is expanding its U.S. manufacturing footprint with new facilities in Indiana and North Carolina. The company plans a distribution center in Indiana and a new excavator factory in North Carolina, shifting certain excavator production from Japan to the U.S. The projects are expected to generate hundreds of jobs and increase domestic supply chain capacity. For you as an investor, this move ties directly to Deere's core role in heavy equipment and machinery, where reliable...
